description: Many Lebanese buildings targeted by Israel's air raids show secondary explosions when weapons stored inside explode.
title: Israeli Forces Target Hezbollah Weapons Stored in Lebanese Homes

description: A look into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Keynote Speeches, Global Protests, and Commemorations

description: Beijing is potentially leveraging TikTok, the short video streaming application, to bolster its strength, Canada’s intelligence agency said in a document recently released publicly. The 2022 document released to the ongoing Foreign Interference Inquiry shows the Canadian Security Intelligence Service (CSIS) expressing concerns about the app’s collection of Western user data and its potential impact […]
title: Beijing Could Exploit TikTok to Bolster Its Power, Says Canada’s Spy Agency in Declassified Document

description: As the House of Commons debated an upcoming Conservative non-confidence motion that is likely to fail, a Bloc Quebecois MP said their party will have “other chances” to vote against the Liberals and bring about an early election. Since the NDP ended its supply-and-confidence agreement with the minority Liberal government, and as the Conservatives are […]
title: Bloc Says There Will be ‘Other Chances’ to Vote Against Liberals During Debate on Non-Confidence Motion

description: Health care providers should now 'advise travelers that mpox exposure risk is associated with sexual contact,' the CDC says.
title: CDC Issues Health Alert on Mpox Vaccine Recommendations

description: SEOUL, South Korea—South Korea hosted the first joint Korean War POW/MIA Recognition Day with the United States in Seoul on Sept. 21. The event honored American soldiers who were prisoners of war (POWs) or went missing in action (MIA) during the Korean War. Since 1979, POW/MIA Recognition Day has been observed in the United States […]
title: South Korea Hosts 1st Joint Repatriation Ceremony for Missing and Fallen US Soldiers of Korean War

description: Commentary The recent announcement that the Alberta government intends to provide funding in its education budget for new independent schools is entirely welcome news in every respect. This is not surprising coming from such a sensible and often innovative government. Premier Danielle Smith has a strong claim to the title of the most capable and successful […]
title: Conrad Black: Alberta’s Independent Schools Initiative Could Lead the Way in Reversing the Decline in Canada’s Educational Standards

description: The Alberta government says it will propose amendments to the province’s Bill of Rights this fall, including strengthened protections for gun and property rights, as well as the right to refuse vaccinations or other medical procedures. Premier Danielle Smith announced plans to introduce legislation in the coming weeks to “amend and strengthen” the Alberta Bill […]
title: Alberta to ‘Strengthen’ Bill of Rights on Bodily Autonomy, Property, Guns

description: Bank of Canada governor Tiff Macklem says he is pleased that inflation has fallen to two percent, but the central bank now has to “stick the landing” and keep price growth centred around the target. That’s according to prepared remarks the governor delivered in Toronto on Tuesday at an event hosted by the Institute of […]
title: Macklem Says Bank of Canada Needs to ‘Stick the Landing’ With Inflation Now at 2%

description: The heat is rising for Quebec Premier François Legault as opposition parties demand answers about his government’s investment in the planned Northvolt battery factory near Montreal. Opposition leaders at the Quebec legislature on Tuesday called on the government to be more transparent about its agreement with the Swedish manufacturer for the $7-billion project. The demands […]
title: Quebec Premier Under Pressure Over $7-billion Northvolt Battery Plant

description: As the Liberal government is set to survive a first non-confidence vote in the House of Commons, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said he’s open to discussions about doing more for seniors, a key demand of the Bloc Québécois. Speaking to reporters in New York City on Sept. 24, Trudeau didn’t commit to supporting the Bloc’s […]
title: On Bloc Québécois Demand to Back Liberals, Trudeau Says Ready to Work With ‘Any Progressives’

description: Canada and the United States say they have created a task force to negotiate a boundary dispute in the Arctic. The two countries have a long-standing dispute over a section of the Beaufort Sea, disagreeing over a treaty dating from 1825. The countries say in a statement the task force will work on resolving overlapping […]
title: Canada, US to Negotiate Beaufort Sea Boundary Dispute

description: The Conservative Party of BC is promising to implement a tax rebate for housing costs while the NDP announced reforms to health care, as the parties continue on the campaign trail ahead of the Oct. 19 election. Conservative Party leader John Rustad announced the rebate plan in Surrey on Sept. 23, saying it would provide […]
title: BC Conservatives Propose Tax Credit for Housing Costs on Campaign Trail, NDP Promises Health Care Reforms

description: While addressing the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday, President Joe Biden reinforced his administration’s support for Ukraine in its war against Russia.
title: Biden to UN: ‘We Will Not Let Up on Our Support for Ukraine’

description: One man has been arrested and another suspect remains at large after police say they stole two luxury cars from a parking garage and tried to escape by ramming the vehicles through a police barricade in the Toronto’s downtown area. Toronto Police Service said as of Sept. 24, the second suspect remains at large. At […]
title: 1 Man Arrested After Car Theft Suspects Try to Drive Through Police Barricade in Toronto

description: Canada says Egypt will soon stop requiring cumbersome visas for Canadian tourists nearly a year after Cairo imposed the measure on Canadian passport holders. Last October, Egypt suspended Canadians’ ability to get a visa online or upon arriving in Egypt, which cost roughly $35 for a single person. Since then Canadians have been paying $150 […]
title: Egypt to Restore e-Visa for Canadian Tourists After Imposing Costly Process: Joly

description: After condemning escalating tensions in the Middle East, President Joe Biden called for an end to the civil war in Sudan in his address to the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday—his last time to do so while in office.
title: Biden Calls for End to Civil War in Sudan During Address to UN General Assembly

description: Rep. Melanie Stansbury (D-N.M.) and others hold a press conference on legislation to commercially disrupt global criminal networks and suppliers of illicit drugs like fentanyl at 2:00 p.m. ET on Sept. 24.
title: LIVE NOW: Rep. Stansbury Speaks on Legislation to Disrupt Global Criminal Drug Networks

description: A defense analyst said that President Putin would be disappointed by the Satan II missile failure, having put his 'personal stamp' on several nuclear programs.
title: Satellite Images Suggest Failure of Russian Nuclear Missile Test: Experts

description: Swedish officials said Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps carried out a cyberattack on a Swedish company that runs a major messaging service.
title: Sweden Accuses Iran of Sending Thousands of Texts Calling for Revenge After Quran Burnings

description: WestJet has been instructed by B.C.’s Civil Resolution Tribunal to issue a full refund to a family for their diverted flight, and to compensate them for any associated costs incurred. The family of three was travelling from Hawaii to Vancouver in April 2023 when their aircraft was redirected to Victoria due to smoke from a […]
title: WestJet Ordered to Compensate Family $2K for Flight Diversion

description: CIBC is the latest Canadian bank to face fines for records-keeping violations in the United States. The Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has imposed a US$30-million penalty, while the Securities and Exchange Commission announced charges that have led to a US$12-million penalty against two CIBC divisions. The charges relate to the use of unapproved communications […]
title: CIBC Paying US$42 Million for US Records-Keeping Violations

description: Driven by fake credit applications and identity theft, automotive fraud has surged 54 percent from a year ago, a report from Equifax Canada has found. “That kind of increase really indicates there’s a specific targeted attack to that sector,” said Carl Davies, head of fraud and identity at Equifax Canada, in an interview. The biggest […]
title: ID Theft and False Credit Applications Drive 54% Surge in Auto Fraud: Equifax Canada

description: Former defence secretary appeared before inquiry examining whether the elite regiment carried out extrajudicial killings of unarmed Afghan civilians during war.
title: Sir Ben Wallace Denies He ‘Lacked Curiosity’ Over SAS Afghanistan Allegations

description: The prime minister also pledged to reduce net immigration and said he would introduce a new apprenticeship scheme to help fill the skills gap with UK workers.
title: Starmer to Introduce ‘Hillsborough Law’ Requiring Duty of Candour From Public Bodies

description: Senate officials say they were told in January 2021 about phishing emails targeting parliamentary accounts—attacks that were later attributed to hackers acting on behalf of Beijing. The officials say some of the emails made it through firewalls and landed in senators’ email inboxes, but no one opened the messages and the attackers did not gain […]
title: Hackers Didn’t Gain Access to Senate Information in 2021 Incident: Officials

description: A senior Japanese official said this was the first time flares had been used against an airspace intruder.
title: Japan Fighter Jets Fire Flares as Russian Aircraft Violates Airspace

description: The government failed to strike a deal with nurses in England, having secured an agreement with junior doctors for a 22 percent increase.
title: Nurses Reject Government’s 5.5 Percent Pay Rise Offer

description: Ukrainian presidential adviser Vladyslav Vlasiuk urged Europe to sanction Russia's nuclear firm Rosatom.
title: China Is Main Supplier of Foreign Tech in Russian Weapons: Ukraine

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau told host Stephen Colbert on an appearance of “The Late Show” on Sept. 23 that many Canadians are blaming their economic issues on him for “understandable reasons.” The prime minister was a guest on Colbert’s show while in New York for the United Nations General Assembly and the Summit of the […]
title: What Prime Minister Trudeau Told Colbert on ‘The Late Show’

description: Turkish president meets Iranian counterpart in New York to discuss steadily escalating regional crisis.
title: NATO Member Turkey Decries Israeli Attacks on Southern Lebanon

description: The City of Montreal issued a lockdown notice for some residents of an east-end borough on Monday night due to a battery fire at the city’s port that has since been brought under control. Officials lifted the shelter-in-place advisory around 10:30 p.m., and the city indicated that tests had found nothing toxic in the smoke […]
title: Lockdown Notice Lifted as Firefighters Control Battery Fire at Port of Montreal

description: Picket lines have gone up at six grain terminals in Metro Vancouver as workers began a strike. More than 600 workers represented by Grain Workers Union Local 333 are off the job. Union president Douglas Lea-Smith says the employer need to come back to the bargaining table to negotiate a deal. The union says it […]
title: Picket Lines Go Up as Strike Begins at Six Grain Terminals in Metro Vancouver

description: Ontario Premier Doug Ford is calling on the Toronto District School Board (TDSB) to urgently conduct an investigation into a field trip that saw students attend a rally where pro-Palestinian slogans were being chanted. The province’s largest school board has been fielding heavy criticism since students attending an event in support of the Grassy Narrows […]
title: Doug Ford Calls for Probe into ‘Disgraceful’ Student Field Trip Involving ‘Palestinian Rally’

description: Commentary What’s next for Britain’s Conservatives, after having suffered a major defeat in the UK’s recent general election, removed from office after governing for 14 years, abandoned by millions of voters who either refused to vote or protested by voting Reform UK, and replaced by a Labour government of which little is expected by a […]
title: Preston Manning: What’s Next for Britain’s Conservatives?

description: Mike Goetz has added bill collector to his list of responsibilities as mayor of Merritt in British Columbia’s Interior. In June, Goetz sent the province an invoice for $103,831.87, the cost, he said, for closures of the Nicola Valley Hospital emergency room. He said the bill for the 19 closures last year and the first […]
title: ‘Scotch Tape and Wet Paper’: Healing Fragile BC Health System Is Key Election Issue

description: Human remains resting in a remote Arctic cairn, visible emblems of one of the North’s most enduring mysteries, finally have a name. Scientists have managed to identify bones belonging to a member of the Franklin expedition, a 19th-century voyage of exploration and discovery that ended in disaster, starvation and death. James Fitzjames—only the second member […]
title: Scientists Use DNA to Identify Bones, Find Descendants of Franklin Expedition Sailor

description: President Joe Biden delivers remarks to the 79th Session of the U.N. General Assembly at 10:00 a.m. ET on Sept. 24.
title: Biden Delivers Remarks to the 79th Session of the UN General Assembly

description: Expected and possible flood warnings come with a forecast of dropping temperatures and a 'more autumnal feel' across the UK.
title: Met Office Warns of Further Flooding, Issues Yellow Alert

description: A federal inquiry into foreign interference is slated to hear today from parliamentary security officials including House of Commons sergeant-at-arms Patrick McDonell. The testimony could shed new light on efforts by hostile countries to target parliamentarians via cyberspace and what officials are doing to counter the threats. description: Home Secretary Yvette Cooper outlined the plans at Labour Party conference as part of the government's mission to make Britain's streets safer.
title: Government to Crack Down on Antisocial Behaviour and Shoplifting

description: The Senate Foreign Relations Committee holds a hearing on threats against cyberspace in the era of rising authoritarianism and global competition at 10 a.m. ET on Sept. 24. Witnesses: Laura Cunningham, president, Open Technology Fund in Washington, D.C. David Kaye, clinical professor of law, University of California–Irvine Jamil N. Jaffer, founder and executive director, National […]
title: LIVE NOW: Senate Foreign Relations Committee Hearing on Cyber Threat in Era of Rising Authoritarianism

description: The step addresses Brazil's Supreme Court demands, moving forward a months-long legal dispute over free speech vs alleged misinformation.
title: X Complies With Brazilian Court Demand That Led to Shutdown

description: ROME—Two foreign tourists, a 5-month-old baby and his grandmother, were missing on Tuesday after floods hit Italy’s central Tuscany region overnight, firefighters said. Rescuers searched for the two on Tuesday using divers, rescue dogs, and drones. The baby’s parents and grandfather were rescued from a rooftop after the house where they were staying was flooded […]
title: 2 Foreign Tourists, Baby and His Grandmother, Are Missing After Floods Hit Central Italy

description: Modified e-bikes can reach speeds up to 70 mph, posing the same danger as a motorbike coming up alongside a pedestrian.
title: Police Report Surge in Seizures of Illegally Modified E-Bikes

description: One Beirut official said Monday's death toll was the highest for a single day since the 1975-1990 civil war.
title: Israel Strikes ‘Dozens’ More Hezbollah Targets Overnight

description: More than 944,000 people in the UK have dementia, and that figure is set to rise to 1.6 million by 2040, with cases rising rapidly, even among younger people.
title: £1 Million Study to Investigate Non-Invasive Treatment for Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s

description: A 51-year-old Australian nurse was arrested at Istanbul Airport, accused of being involved with Marxist terror group the PKK.
title: Australian Nurse Arrested in Turkey on Terror Charges

description: 5 people have been arrested after a Greenpeace protest outside the Wellington office of mining lobby group Straterra, which closed a city road.

description: Bullock stated that Australia sets its interest rates based on domestic circumstances, noting that we have been less restrictive compared to some others.
title: RBA Governor Explains Why Australia Lags Behind in Interest Rate Cuts

description: Spurred by a plea from the family of Zomi Frankcom, killed in an Israeli airstrike, Australia will work toward getting a UN declaration to protect aid workers.

description: The Libertarians describe themselves as the 'purist form' of the Liberal Party will likely pick up 15 seats at the recent NSW council elections.

description: RBA says inflation has significantly decreased since its 2022 peak, thanks to higher interest rates that have aligned aggregate demand and supply.

description: Queensland has what some in the resources industry dub the 'highest taxes in the world.'

description: The Greens are waiting for Labor to make a counteroffer.

description: B.C. Conservative Leader John Rustad said the vaccine mandates seemed to be more about “shaping public opinion” and controlling the population. Rustad made the comments in a video interview posted on July 23 by the B.C. Public Service Employees for Freedom which opposes vaccine mandates. The video was publicized on Sept. 23 by the Conservatives’ […]
title: BC Conservative Leader Says COVID Mandate Was About Controlling the Population

description: TOKYO—Japan’s meteorological agency issued a tsunami advisory Tuesday morning to remote islands south of Tokyo after an earthquake that may have been triggered by volcanic activity. The offshore quake was not felt, and no damage or injuries have been reported. The Japan Meteorological Agency said a magnitude 5.9 quake hit off the Izu Islands and […]
title: Japan Advises Remote Japanese Islands of Potential Tsunami After Undersea Earthquake

description: As the Online Harms Act went through second reading in the House of Commons, Liberals said the bill would protect children and victims of sexual exploitation, while Conservatives raised concerns about the legislation leading to censorship and disproportionate penalties for crimes. “What is contemplated in this law is taking current jurisprudence that applies in the […]
title: ‘Censorship’ or Protecting Children: Parties Clash in House Debate on Online Harms Bill

description: Three years after his release from captivity in China, Michael Kovrig recounted in his first public interview the torment he endured from the communist regime. Speaking to CBC’s Adrienne Arsenault, the former Canadian diplomat disclosed how he was forcibly pulled away from his partner, who was 6-months pregnant. He was then blindfolded, taken to a […]
title: ‘I Underestimated Their Ruthlessness’: Michael Kovrig Recounts Suffering Under CCP Captivity
